author: MaximoTrinidad
body:
# Summary of the new feature/enhancement

In the scenario where krb5-user (in Ubuntu Kerberos client) has been installed and configured to connect to a Windows System joined AD domain using PowerShell Core remoting, will connect opening a Windows PowerShell session.

It would be nice in both Windows and other cross-platform systems to have the ability to choose with PowerShell Edition to use: Windows PowerShell, PowerShell, or PowerShell Preview.

Maybe adding and -PSEdition parameter then providing which PowerShell Edition to connect.

comments.author: SteveL-MSFT
comments.body: You can do this today already.  When using `New-PSSession`, use the `-ConfigurationName` parameter.  By default, it uses `Microsoft.PowerShell` which maps to Windows PowerShell.  If you run `Enable-PSRemoting` from PSCore6, it creates `PowerShell.6` or `PowerShell.6-Preview` depending on the release as well as the version specific one like `PowerShell.6.1.0`.
